title: Katie Price confirms she's back with fiancé Kris Boyson as she posts sweet family snaps
text:
She was recently rocked by claims from her former fling Charles Drury who said the pair enjoyed a 'cocaine-fuelled romp'.

But Katie Price put the drama behind her as she enjoyed some family time with her fiancé Kris Boyson and children Bunny, five, and Junior, 14, on Sunday.

The former glamour model, 41, confirmed that things were back on track between them as she took to Instagram to share a sweet snap of her beau larking around with her youngest child, before they headed to a Halloween event with Junior.

Happy families: Katie Price confirms she's back with fiancé Kris Boyson as she posts sweet Instagram snap of him and her daughter Bunny

The first picture she uploaded saw the fitness buff beaming at Bunny as he balanced her on his leg.

And Bunny appeared delighted with Kris as she dipped her back and roared with laughter.

Captioning the image, she wrote: 'Love this picture of my Bunny boo and @krisboyson', alongside a heart emoji.

Katie later shared a snap of herself, Kris and Junior wrapped up against the cold as they enjoyed a night out at the Broadwitch Hauntfest 2019 in Southfleet, Kent.

All together: Katie later shared a snap of herself, Kris and Junior wrapped up against the cold as they enjoyed a night out at the Broadwitch Hauntfest 2019 in Southfleet, Kent

Thrilling: Katie was clearly having a whale of a time as she also shared a fun snap on Instagram stories of herself surrounded by ghoulish, spooky characters

Katie was clearly having a whale of a time as she also shared a fun snap on Instagram stories of herself surrounded by ghoulish, spooky characters.

The touching family images appear to confirm that she's very much back in Kris' good books after a rocky few months between the two.

The couple briefly split after Katie enjoyed a short-lived fling with Charles Drury, 22, earlier this year.

Katie and Kris' show of unity comes amid Charles' claims that they enjoyed a 'cocaine-fuelled romp' in a hotel spa during their first date.

Shock remarks: She was recently rocked by claims from her former fling Charles Drury who said the pair enjoyed a 'cocaine-fuelled romp'

Together again? The touching image appears to confirm that she's very much back in Kris' good books after a rocky few months between the two (Katie pictured with Kris in July)

The builder branded Katie who is in recovery, a zero-to-one out of ten in the bedroom and called her a 'lazy lover' after they had spent the evening bingeing on drinks and drugs.

He told The Sun that drugs were already there when he arrived and said when he woke up in the morning, Katie still hadn't gone to bed.

He said: 'We had a few drinks to relax and then headed up to the hotel room where we had even more and that's when things started to get intimate for the first time.'

Charles said he found the night 'disappointing' and an 'anti-climax'.

He said: 'I can't say zero, can I? I'd give her a one out of ten. She was a bit lazy, but then suddenly she would surprise you and jump on top.'

Drama: Charles also branded Katie who is in recovery, a zero-to-one out of ten in the bedroom and called her a 'lazy lover' (pictured in a video from her YouTube channel)

Charles claims Katie stayed up all night, while he slept and trashed the hotel room and said he had to 'pick up snotty tissues in the morning.'

He said: 'She was still wide awake the morning after. The hotel was a mess, so whatever she was up to in the night, I was sleeping through.'

He did defend her by saying is a good mother but is using drugs to cope, but claims she is 'all over the place'.

A spokesperson for Katie Price told MailOnline: 'There is no truth in the allegation that she is taking drugs every day and has made significant steps to being drug free.

'There have been lapses in the past but they are just that, not a regular event. Katie is still in recovery and making progress.'
description: Katie Price, 41, confirmed she's back with fiancé Kris Boyson as she posts sweet family Instagram snaps, after ex Charles Drury's 'cocaine-fuelled romp' claims.
